greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(n, Product_{p|n} (p-1)), where the product is over the distinct primes, p, that divide n.
comment: Product_{p|n} (p-1) is the absolute value of A023900(n) (that is, A173557(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: a(n) = gcd(n, A173557(n)) = gcd(n, A318841(n)). - _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 17 2018
example: The distinct primes that divide 20 are 2 and 5. So a(20) = gcd(20, (2-1)(5-1)) = gcd(20,4) = 4.
mathematica: f[n_] := GCD[n, Times @@ (First /@ FactorInteger[n] - 1)]; Array[f, 105] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 08 2007 *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Mar 15 2007
